title: Convert to Exponential Form
text: We know that we're trying to determine $$x$$ such that $$x=\log_{2}\left(\frac{1}{32}\right)$$. Rewrite this expression first into exponential form.

title: Determing the Exponential Form
text: What is the exponential form of $$\log_{2}\left(\frac{1}{32}\right)=x$$?
speech: What is the exponential form of  the log base 2 of, parentheses 1 over 32,  is equal to x ?

title: Rewrite $$\frac{1}{16}$$ in terms of $$\frac{1}{2}$$
text: Since $$2^5=32$$, we can actually rewrite $$\frac{1}{32}$$ in terms of $$\frac{1}{2}$$. What is $$\frac{1}{32}$$ equal to in terms of $$\frac{1}{2}$$?
speech: Since  2 to the fifth is equal to 32 , we can actually rewrite  1 over 32,  in terms of  1 half . What is  1 over 32,  equal to in terms of  1 half ?
pacedSpeech: Since   2 to the fifth is equal to 32
equal to in terms of   1 half

title: Simplifying the Exponential
text: We note that $${\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)}^y=x^{\left(-y\right)}$$. How can we rewrite $$\frac{1}{32}={\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)}^5$$ in terms of powers of 2?
speech: We note that  parentheses 1 over x,  to the y-th is equal to x raised to the parentheses negative y  power . How can we rewrite  1 over 32 is equal to, parentheses 1 half  to the fifth  in terms of powers of 2?
pacedSpeech: We note that    1 over x,  to the y-th is equal to x raised to the  negative y  power
. How can we rewrite   1 over 32 is equal to,  1 half  to the fifth

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: Substitution $$2^{\left(-5\right)}$$ into the exponential equation we found before, we get $$2^x=2^{\left(-5\right)}$$. What is $$x$$?
speech: Substitution  2 raised to the parentheses negative 5  power  into the exponential equation we found before, we get  2 to the x-th is equal to 2 raised to the parentheses negative 5  power . What is  x ?

into the exponential equation we found before, we get   2 to the x-th is equal to 2 raised to the  negative 5  power
